definition: to triumph over an opponent
to obtain/to get/to gain/to catch (a disease)/proper/suitable/proud/contented/to allow/to permit/ready/finished
structural particle: used after a verb (or adjective as main verb), linking it to following phrase indicating effect, degree, possibility etc
to have to/must/ought to/to need to

victory/success/to beat/to defeat/to surpass/victorious/superior to/to get the better of/better than/surpassing/superb (of vista)/beautiful (scenery)/wonderful (view)/(Taiwan pr. [sheng1]) able to bear/equal to (a task)
lit. to win a victory on raising the flag (idiom); fig. to start on sth and have immediate success/success in a single move
to prevail/to achieve victory/to be victorious

sentences.english: Had Jesus not died on the cross, Christianity would not have triumphed.
sentences.chinese: 耶稣要是不死在十字架上，基督教就无法取得胜利。

sentences.english: Tashi one-upmanship, eventually obtaining victory like riding.
sentences.chinese: 扎西骑术更胜一筹，最终获得胜利。

sentences.english: Odds have evened between the champions.
sentences.chinese: 争夺冠军的两名选手得胜的机会均等。

sentences.english: No wonder she wins, for she is all old-shoe charm.
sentences.chinese: 难怪她获得胜利，因为她有令人一见如故的魅力。

sentences.english: The horse is made ready for the day of battle, but victory rests with the Lord .
sentences.chinese: 马是为打仗之日预备的，得胜乃在乎耶和华。

sentences.english: Christian warrior — remember that there is victory through the blood of the Lamb!
sentences.chinese: 记住每一次的得胜，都是靠基督宝血而成的。

sentences.english: Once Mao had achieved victory and eliminated his enemies, what was there left for him to do?
sentences.chinese: 当毛取得胜利消灭敌人后，他应该做什么？

sentences.english: Surely, this is to be more than conquerors through Him who loved us.
sentences.chinese: 这就是靠着爱我们的主已得胜有余了。

sentences.english: I cried because you never know if you'll have another chance to win.
sentences.chinese: 我哭了，因为你永远不知道你是否还有机会获得胜利。

sentences.english: Spain's triumphant national football team has returned home from South Africa.
sentences.chinese: 西班牙国家足球队从南非得胜荣归。

sentences.english: Victory in Libya comes first in time and importance.
sentences.chinese: 在利比亚取得胜利，在时间和重要性上应排在第一。

sentences.english: The first rule in winning is to participate!
sentences.chinese: 参与是获得胜利的不二法门。

sentences.english: Our army won victory in the first battle.
sentences.chinese: 这个战役，我军旗开得胜。

sentences.english: Congratulations on your success in the National College Entrance Examination.
sentences.chinese: 祝贺您今年高考旗开得胜，金榜题名。

sentences.english: There was plenty of time for the Middlesbrough batsmen to knock off the runs.
sentences.chinese: 有足够的时间让米德尔斯布勒的击球手取得得胜分。

definition: fight
to seize total victory (idiom); an overwhelming victory/to win by a landslide (in election)
to be defeated on the battlefield/to be beaten in a contest
to defeat/to inflict a defeat on sb
audience/participants/congregation (of religious sect)
lit. to win a victory on raising the flag (idiom); fig. to start on sth and have immediate success/success in a single move
to turn defeat into victory (idiom); snatching victory from the jaws of defeat
Heavenly Father
enemy
to accept/to receive
to praise
to submit to
to return in triumph/to return victorious
favor/grace
to lose a war/fig. the loser (in a competition or election)
to attack and seize
